gurmukhi: gÍwrn rIJ rhI hir pyiK sBY qij lwij su Aau fr swso ]AweI hY iqAwg soaU giH pY Brqwr khy n kCU kih mwso ]
transliteration: Gvaaran Reejh Rahihar(i) Pekh(i) Sabhai Taj(i) Laaj(i) Su Au Dar Saaso|| Ooihai Tiaag Sooo Grih Pai Bharttaar Kahe Na Kachhodh Kah(i) Maaso||
translation: Forsaking the fear of their mother-in-law and also abandoning their shyness, all the gopis have been allured by Krishna on seeing him; without saying anything at their homes and leaving their husbands also;

gurmukhi: folq hY soaU qwl bjwie kY gwvq hY kir kY auphwso ]moih igrY Dr pY su qRIXw kib sXwm khY icqvY hir jwso ]606]
transliteration: Dolat Hai Sooo Taal Bajaae Kai Gadvat Hai Kar(i) Kai Oup-haaso|| Moh(i) Giraidhar Pai Su Treeyaa Kabi Syaam Kahai Chitvai Har(i) Jaaso||606||
translation: They have come here and are roaming hither and thither smilingly, while singing and playing on various tunes; she, whom Krishna sees, she, being charmed, falls on the earth.606.

gurmukhi: jo jug qIsr hY krqw joaU hY qn pY DrIXw pt pIly ]jwih ClXo bilrwj blI ijn SqR hny kr kop hTIly ]
transliteration: Jo Joug Teesar Hai Kartaa Jooo Hai Tan Pai Ddareeyaa Pat Peele|| Jaah(i) Chhalyo Baliraaj Balishatra Hane Kar Kop Hatheele||
translation: He, who is the Lord of Treta age and is wearing yellow raiments; he, who deceived the mighty king Bali and in great ire, had destroyed the persistent enemies;

gurmukhi: gÍwrn rIJ rhI DrnI ju Dry pt pIqn pY su rMgIly ]ijau miRgnI sr lwg igrY ieh iqau hir dyKq nYn rsIly ]607]
transliteration: Gvaaran Reejh Rahidharniju Ddare Pat Peetan Pai Su Raneele|| Jio Mrigadisar Laag Girai Eh Tio Har(i) Dekhat Nain Raseele||607||
translation: On the same Lord, these gopis are being fascinated, who has put on the yellow-coloured garments; just as the does fall down on being shot by the arrows, the same impact is being made (on the gopis) by the voluptuous eyes of Krishna.607.

gurmukhi: kwnHr ky sMg Kylq so Aiq hI suK ko kr kY qn mY ]sXwm hI so Aiq hI hI ihq kY icq kY nih bMDn Aau Dn mY ]
transliteration: Kaahnar Ke San Khelat So At(i) Hisoukh Ko Kar Kai Tan Mai|| Syaam Hiso At(i) Hihit Kai Chit Kai Nah(i) Bandhan Au Dhan Mai||
translation: The gopis are playing with Krishna in extreme joy and consider themselves totally free to love Krishna;

gurmukhi: Dr rMgin bsqR sBy qih folq XO aupmw aupjI mn mY ]joaU PUl muKI qh PUl kY Kylq PUl sI hoie geI bn mY ]608]
transliteration: Dhar Ranad(i) Bastra Sabhe Tah(i) Dolat Yaoun Oupmaa Oupjiman Mai|| Jooo Phool Moukhitah Phool Sihoe Gadban Mai||608||
translation: They are roaming carefree in coloured clothes and this state of theirs creates this simile in the mind that they appear like the bee sucking sap of flowers and playing with them in the forest becomes one with them.608.

gurmukhi: sB Kylq hY mn AwnMd kY Bgvwn ko Dwr sBY mn mYN ]hir ky icqby kI rhI suD eyk n Aaur rhI n kCU qn mYN ]
transliteration: Sabh Khelat Hai Man Aanand Kai Bhagvaan Ko Dhaar Sabhai Man Main|| Har(i) Ke Chitbe Kirahisudh Ek Na Aur Rahina Kachhodh Tan Main||
translation: They are all playing with joy, meditating in their mind on Lord Krishna; they have no consciousness about anyone else except the sight of Krishna;

gurmukhi: nhI BUqlu mYN Aru mwqlu mYN ien so nih dyvn ky gn mYN ]soaU rIJ so sXwm khY Aiq hI Pun folq gÍwrn ky gn mYN ]609]
transliteration: Nahibhootal(u) Main Ar(u) Maatal(u) Main In So Nah(i) Devan Ke Gad Main|| Sooo Reejh So Syaam Kahai At(i) Hiphoun Dolat Gvaaran Ke Gad Main||609||
translation: Their mind is neither in the nether-world, nor in this world of death nor in the abode of gods, but being charmed by their sovereign Krishna, they are losing their balance.609.

gurmukhi: his kY Bgvwn khI bqIXw biRKBwn suqw ipK rUp nvIno ]AMgn Awf Dry pun bysr Bwv sBY ijn Bwvn kIno ]
transliteration: Has(i) Kai Bhagvaan Kahibateeyaa Brikhbhaan Soutaa Pikh Roop Naveeno|| Anad Aad Ddare Poun Besar Bhaav Sabhai Jin Bhaavan Keeno||
translation: Seeing the new winsome beauty of Radha, Lord Krishna talked to her; she had worn on her limbs the ornaments expressing various emotions;

gurmukhi: suMdr syNDr ko ijn lY kir Bwl ibKY ibMdUAw iek dIno ]nYn ncwie mnY suK pwie icqY jdurwie qbY his dIno ]610]
transliteration: Soundar Sendhar Ko Jin Tai Kar(i) Dhaal Bikhai Bindooaa Ik Deeno Nain Nachaae Manai Soukh Paae Chitai Jaduraae Tabai Has(i) Dino||610||
translation: She had applied the mark of vermilion on the forehead and was extremely delighted in her mind on causing her eyes to dance; seeing her, Krishna, the king of Yadavas smiled.610.
